moves.2... c6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. g3: still standard, i could have transposed to the queens gambit by going, 4.d4 but i want to stick with the Reti.
moves.4... Bg4 5. Bg2 e6 6. O-O Bxf3: with black doing this, he allows me the bishop pair.
moves.11... Nxe4 12. Bxe4 e5 13. e3 f5 14. Bg2: i think that the game is about equal.
moves.17. d4 Bb6 18. Rae1 Rae8: now by doing this, he threatens taking on d4 with the pawn
moves.19. Qc2 Kh8 20. a4 h6 21. Bc3: now i can drive his mean old bishop away by going a5.
moves.21... e4 22. a5 Bc7 23. Re2 Nf6 24. Bd2: !? i think that this is a move a GM would make, do you??
moves.25... Qh5 26. Rg2 g5 27. Qc1 Qh3: the sad part about going Bh1!?, is that its trapped!
moves.28. d5 cxd5 29. cxd5 Bd6: i've got to open up some lines
? this just losses a pawn, as you will see.
moves.35... Rxc1+ 36. Bxc1 Bxb4: ! now black is up and im in big trouble!
moves.37. Bd2 Bc5 38. Bc1: willing for a draw, but, black does not want one! (smart idea)
moves.40... Nxf2 41. Qxf2 Ba7 42. d6 Rc6: ?? this is a bad move!! can you guess what my next move was?
moves.43. Bxe4: !! a bolt from the blue!!! this wins no matter what black does! if Rxd6 then Bxf5+winning blacks queen
moves.44. Qf7+ Kh8: black offered me a draw, i declined thinking that i might have a win!
moves.45. d7:
! this wins! and at this part i will let you figure out why this wins! (if any questions about why this wins, contact me) oh, and black resigns! hope that you liked the game? please comment and rate it on the star system.
